prompt:
Nurse: That's good to hear. It's critical to be in good health before your procedure. Now, I see that your anticipated discharge plan is to go home after the procedure. Is that still correct?

Patient: Yes.

Nurse: Excellent. It's critical to have a plan for when you return home. Have you arranged for a ride home and for someone to stay with you after the procedure?

Patient: Yes.

Nurse: That's great to hear. It's essential to have someone to assist you as you recover. If for any reason that changes, remember you still have time to arrange it. Now, do you have any other questions or concerns about your upcoming procedure?

Patient: No.

Nurse: Alright, let's summarize what you still need to do before your procedure. You need to stop taking Aspirin immediately, use the chlorhexidine scrub the night before and the morning of your procedure, and remember not to eat or drink anything after midnight before your procedure. Can I count on you to do all of this?

Patient: Yes.

responses.gpt4: Great. Know that we're here for you every step of the way. You can call back at any time if you have any questions. Our number is 641-381-6523. You're doing a wonderful job preparing for this, and soon, you'll have a new knee and the improved mobility that comes with it. Thank you for your time today, patient. I look forward to your procedure going smoothly on August 13th. Do you have any final questions or is there anything else I can assist you with today?
responses.our_model: That's wonderful. Remember, I'm here for you every step of the way. If you have any questions at any time, you can call me back at 641-381-6523. I want to thank you for your time today. I hope your upcoming procedure goes smoothly and helps you get back to your normal activities, including your love for fishing. Take care and goodbye for now.
